title: Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson embraces Jurgen Klopp's target of winning ALL their remaining games
text:
Sport Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson embraces Jurgen Klopp's target of winning ALL their remaining games Reds looked back to their best as they beat Spurs in first match since the boss revealed his optimistic goal for the run-in Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Liverpool players still celebrating win over Spurs Share this video Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jordan Henderson has told Liverpool to believe in the impossible, by winning all their remaining games to revive the title race. 
The Reds stand 11 points behind leaders Chelsea after a disastrously dry January where they failed to win a single Premier League game. 
But manager Jurgen Klopp issued a rallying cry before a must-win showdown with Spurs, by challenging his team to win all 14 of their fixtures until the end of the season. 
And after notching up victory number one in exhilarating style, captain Henderson explained the aim is to perform the same in the rest in search of the perfect end to the season... and the chance to at least put pressure on Chelsea. 
“That is the aim," said the midfielder. Henderson and Klopp are rallying the troops for a strong end to the season (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Read More ANDY DUNN: Irresistible Reds make it one down, 13 to go in pursuit of Klopp's dream ending 
"From day one we’ve said the aim is to win every game. Sometimes it is not possible but that’s our aim and our aim is to do that from now until the end of the season,” he explained. 
“We have fantastic quality in the team, great mentality and great character, but it is no good me saying that it is up to us to show that from now until the end of the season. 
“As players we take the responsibility as we feel as though we have let ourselves down, the manager down and the fans down. 
“Putting in that performance against Spurs doesn’t make up for it, but it is a start and a step in the right direction. No we have to build on that and keep going.” Read More The win over Spurs was Liverpool's first of the year in the league (Photo: Getty for Tottenham Hotspur) Read More Liverpool bounced back to form after fiery players-only meeting called by skipper 
Liverpool jet out this week for a mid-season break at La Manga in Spain, where Klopp is hoping to build the fitness levels and team spirit to support a late season charge. 
And there is much to play for, even if the title seems out of reach. Before City played last night, there was just two points separating the teams from second to sixth, with only three of them guaranteed a Champions League place. 
That is the minimum aim for the Reds this season, and despite the dismal run of one win in 10 games before vanquishing Spurs, Henderson believes the qualities are there within the Liverpool squad to mount a serious challenge. 
“You have to stick together. It was a tough time because we knew we hadn’t won for so long and performance levels were not up to standard,” he added. Read More
